availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Roy Stuart Cluke (Farmer, Colonel in CSA)

body.p: Farmer and soldier. Montgomery County, Kentucky native. Married to Kate Kerr Cluke May 1, 1855. Father of Roy Cluke. Appointed Colonel in the 8th Regiment Kentucky Cavalry of the Confederate States of America on September 10, 1862, captured July 26, 1863, and confined to Johnsonâ€™s Island, Ohio. Died January 1, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film #183145, p. 41

Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 26
